turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: This is Marcus from Apex Collections calling for Michael Chen. Is this Michael?

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Yes, this is Michael. What's this about?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Mr Chen, I'm calling about your overdue account with FastCash Loans. You currently owe $12,847.50 and this account is now 97 days past due. This is your seventh contact attempt.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Right, yes, I know about this. Look, I've been meaning to call you guys. I had some unexpected medical bills and I lost my job back in October. I'm trying to get back on my feet.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Mr Chen, I've heard every excuse in the book. Medical bills, job loss, car problems. Everyone has a story. What I need from you right now is a commitment to pay. Can you pay the full amount today?

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: The full amount? No, I just told you I lost my job. I can maybe do $200 a month when I start my new position next week.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: $200 a month? That's nothing. At that rate, with interest accruing at 24.9%, you'd be paying this off for the next decade. Look, I need at least $3,000 today to stop this from going to legal.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I don't have $3,000. I literally just explained my situation. Can you not listen?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: I am listening, Mr Chen. But what you're not understanding is the seriousness of this. We're talking about legal action here. We can garnish your wages, put a lien on your property. Do you own your home at 47 Parkview Crescent, Burwood?

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: What? How do you know my address? Are you threatening to take my house?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: I'm not threatening anything. I'm informing you of the consequences. And yes, we have all your details. Date of birth 15th March 1985, mobile 0412 555 789, employer... well, former employer... Westfield Group. We know everything, Mr Chen.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: This feels really intimidating. I'm trying to work with you here but you're making it very difficult.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Difficult? You want to talk about difficult? Try being in my position, calling people who refuse to pay their debts day after day. You took the money, you spent it, now it's time to pay up. Simple as that.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I didn't refuse to pay. I had a medical emergency. My wife was in hospital for three weeks. Do you have any compassion at all?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Compassion doesn't pay bills, Mr Chen. Your wife's medical situation, while unfortunate, is not our problem. The contract you signed doesn't have a 'life got hard' clause. Now, can we get back to how you're going to resolve this TODAY?

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Today? I already told you I don't have it today. What part of that don't you understand? You're being completely unreasonable.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: I'm unreasonable? You're the one who borrowed $8,000 and now owes almost $13,000 because you couldn't be bothered to make payments. That's irresponsible, Mr Chen. That's on you.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: The interest rate you people charge is criminal. 24.9%? That should be illegal.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Well it's not illegal, and you agreed to it when you signed. Should have read the fine print before you took the money. Too late for buyer's remorse now.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I want to speak to your supervisor. This conversation is completely unprofessional.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: My supervisor will tell you exactly the same thing. Actually, they'll probably be less patient than I am. Look, I'm trying to help you here. If this goes to our legal team, they'll add another $2,500 in fees and you'll have a court judgment on your record. That'll follow you for years. Forget about getting a mortgage, a car loan, anything. Your credit will be destroyed.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Are you seriously trying to scare me right now? This is harassment.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: It's not harassment, it's reality. I'm doing you a favor by being straight with you. Most collectors would have already handed this to the lawyers. I'm giving you one last chance.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: One last chance? You've called me seven times! Each time someone demands money I don't have. What do you want me to do, sell my organs?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Don't be dramatic. You could sell that car of yours. We know you have a 2019 Toyota Camry registered to your address. That's worth at least $25,000. Sell it, pay us, problem solved.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: That's my wife's car! She needs it to get to her dialysis appointments! Are you out of your mind?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Everyone's got an excuse. Dialysis, chemo, dying grandmother. I've heard it all. The fact remains you owe money and you need to pay it. Period. End of story.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: You're a disgusting human being. You know that? My wife is actually sick and you're mocking it? What is wrong with you?

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: What's wrong with me? I'm just doing my job. You're the one who can't manage your finances. Maybe if you'd been more responsible, you wouldn't be in this mess. But no, you wanted the easy money and now you can't handle the consequences.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I'm going to file a complaint. This call is probably recorded, right? I hope your managers hear how you treat people.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Go ahead and complain. Won't change the fact that you owe $12,847.50 and it's going up every day. While you're busy complaining, that interest keeps ticking. Tick, tick, tick. Your choice.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Fine. I'll pay $500 a month. That's all I can do. Take it or leave it.

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: $500 a month still doesn't cover the interest. You'd never pay this off. Look, I need a minimum of $5,000 upfront or we're sending this to legal tomorrow morning. I'm not joking. Tomorrow. First thing.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: I DON'T HAVE $5,000! How many times do I have to say it? You're not listening to anything I'm saying!

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Then I guess we'll see you in court, Mr Chen. Maybe a judge can explain to you what personal responsibility means. I'll make a note on your file that you refused to cooperate.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: Refused to cooperate?! I offered to pay! You're the one who won't accept it! This is insane!

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: I've wasted enough time on this call. Legal action will commence tomorrow. Have a nice day, Mr Chen. You'll be hearing from our lawyers.

turns.speaker: CUSTOMER
turns.text: You're going to regret this. I'm recording this whole conversation and I'm going to—

turns.speaker: AGENT
turns.text: Goodbye, Mr Chen.
